SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes
Class StrokeText

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.Shape
          SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.StrokeText
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
public class StrokeText
extends Shape

A StrokeText object draws a character string with a specified size, orientation and alignment, using a StrokedFont object to draw the individual characters as a sequence of line segments. The "Simplex" fonts are drawn with single lines. The "Duplex" and "Complex" fonts are draw with pairs of lines, with "Complex" fonts being somewhat more elaborate than "Duplex" fonts of the same type. For example, RomanComplex includes serifs on the characters whereas RomanDuplex does not. "Triplex" fonts are drawn with sets of three lines.

See Also:
SSG_Tools.Fonts.CyrilicComplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.GothicBritishTriplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.GothicGermanTriplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.GothicItalianTriplex, GreekComplex, GreekSimplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.ItalicComplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.ItalicTriplex, RomanComplex, RomanDuplex, RomanSimplex, RomanTriplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.ScriptComplex, SSG_Tools.Fonts.ScriptSimplex

Constructor Detail

StrokeText

public StrokeText(java.lang.String text,
                  StrokeFont font)
Construct a StrokeText object for the specified string and font. The string will have have character height 1, positioned at the origin in the x,y plane with base in the +x direction and up in the +y direction by default.

Parameters:
text - The text string to draw when this object is drawn.
font - The font to use when this object is drawn.

Calculate the width of the current string in 3D "world" coordinates.

setPosition

public void setPosition(Vector3D position)
Set the position of this character string in 3D "world" coordinates. The string placement, relative to the specified position, is controlled by the alignment.

Parameters:
position - The position of the "alignment point" for this string in 3D "world" coordinates.

setOrientation

public void setOrientation(Vector3D base,
                           Vector3D up)
Set the orientation of this character string in 3D "world" coordinates.

Parameters:
base - The base vector this string
up - The up vector this string

setHeight

public void setHeight(float height)
Set the height of this character string in 3D "world" coordinates.

Parameters:
height - The new string height

setAlignment

public void setAlignment(int horiz_align,
                         int vert_align)
Set the horizontal and vertical alignment of this character string.

Parameters:
horiz_align - The horizontal alignment to use for this string. This should be one of: HORIZ_LEFT, HORIZ_CENTER or HORIZ_RIGHT.
vert_align - The vertical alignment to use for this string. This should be one of: VERT_TOP, VERT_CAP, VERT_HALF, VERT_BASE or VERT_BOTTOM.

Render

public void Render(net.java.games.jogl.GLDrawable drawable)
Actually draw the string in the specified font with the specified height, alignment, etc. NOTE: This should not be called directly from application code; it is called "automatically" when the window is rendered.

Parameters:
drawable - The drawable to which the text is drawn.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main program that tests this object by displaying it in a frame.
